recipe.name: Chickpea Fajitas
recipe.description: Chickpea Fajitas are a flavorful and healthy vegetarian alternative to traditional fajitas, featuring roasted chickpeas seasoned with paprika, served with pickled tomatoes and onions, creamy avocado, and harissa-spiced sour cream, all wrapped in warm corn tortillas.
steps: Heat oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6 and line a baking tray with foil.
Drain the chickpeas, pat dry, and tip onto the prepared baking tray.
Add the oil and paprika, toss to coat, then roast for 20-25 minutes until browned and crisp, shaking halfway through cooking.
Meanwhile, put the chopped tomatoes and finely sliced red onion in a small bowl with the red wine vinegar and set aside to pickle.
In another bowl, mash the avocado with a fork, leaving some larger chunks. Stir in the lime juice and season well.
Mix the sour cream with the harissa spice and set aside until ready to serve.
Heat a griddle pan until nearly smoking. Add the tortillas, one at a time, charring each side until hot with griddle lines.
To assemble, spread a little of the harissa cream over each tortilla, top with roasted chickpeas, guacamole, pickled salsa, and coriander, if desired. Serve with lime wedges for squeezing over.
From your hands to the table—enjoy every bite!
